programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.desc: Martha shares her love of houseplants and brings the outdoors into her home. Learn all about the most popular and sought after houseplants, topiaries and begonias and how to take care of them.

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.desc: Succulents are known for their vibrant colors, interesting textures, and often beautiful blooms. Martha explores how best to care for succulents including watering, fertilizing, and repotting.

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.sub-title: Inside Martha's Vegetable Greenhouse; Seed Starting
programme.desc: Martha takes us inside her vegetable greenhouse to see how she has turned her harvest into a year-round bounty. Then, how she collects, stores, and sows seeds. Plus Martha makes her perfect green drink.

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.desc: Martha visits the incredible Orchid Show at the New York Botanical Garden. This year's show immerses you in a mesmerizing array of orchids designed by acclaimed artist Lily Kwong.

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.desc: Meet Martha's chickens! Now with over 200 chickens and 20 different breeds, Martha shares her vast knowledge about raising and caring for her flock. Then learn the how-tos of building the a coop.

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.sub-title: Martha Builds a Raised Bed Vegetable Garden
programme.desc: Martha builds a brand new, half-acre raised bed vegetable garden on her farm! It's a step-by-step guide to designing, building, preparing the soil, and planting.

programme.title: Martha Bakes
programme.desc: Follow Martha as she creates delicious breakfast pastries with an easy-to-prepare yeast dough: pear and frangipane pastries, brown butter swirl, and jam-filled croustades

programme.title: Martha Bakes
programme.desc: Martha shows how adding patterns can change your cookies, cakes, and tarts, including an apricot cheesecake tart, marbleized roulade, and brown butter honey cookies

programme.title: Martha Bakes
programme.desc: Ginger can add a peppery, sweet taste to your dishes. Martha demonstrates how to incorporate it: molasses-ginger crisps, ginger-pear hand pies, and lemon-ginger scones

programme.title: Martha Bakes
programme.desc: Martha shares how to incorporate fresh cheeses into three delectable desserts: tart au fromage, cannoli cake, and cheesecake babka

programme.title: Martha Bakes
programme.desc: Martha shares her favorite recipes based on a simple and delicious yellow cake, including her father's birthday cake, stone fruit upside-down cake, and strawberry cupcakes

programme.title: Martha Bakes
programme.desc: Watch Martha demonstrate three delightfully rich pound cake recipes, from traditional to one inspired by her travels through Asia, using butter, cream cheese, and semolina

programme.title: Martha Bakes
programme.desc: Martha makes puff pastry approachable for any home cook. She creates a variety of savory and sweet goodies using puff pastry including the iconic French pastry, the Napoleon

programme.title: Martha Bakes
programme.desc: Martha presents three light and airy brioche bread variations: brioche a tete, brioche loaf, and baba au Rhum. Plus, Martha's French toast

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Renowned seafood chef Dave Pasternack joins Martha for a lesson on buying, cleaning, filleting, and storing fish. Plus, an easy-to-prepare recipe for crudo

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Sauteing is one of the quickest and most versatile cooking methods. Martha prepares wiener schnitzel, chicken piccata, and sole à la meuniere. Plus, pan sauces to serve with each

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Dumplings are a mainstay in nearly every cuisine around the world. Watch Martha make Italian dumplings gnocchi and gnudi; plus, her family recipe for Polish pierogi

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Whole grains are an integral part of a healthy lifestyle. Martha provides an overview of grains and the different cooking methods for polenta, bulgur, quinoa, and farro

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Martha discusses two of the oldest preserving techniques, confit and salting, and how to use them at home: duck confit, tomato confit, and gravlax, a cured salmon appetizer

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Martha and chef Cesare Casella shed light on legumes, exploring the varieties and how to cook them using three different methods: stovetop, oven, and pressure cooker

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Learn about buying, storing, shelling, and deveining shrimp. Martha makes shrimp cocktail, shrimp scampi, a traditional shrimp boil, and simple grilled shrimp
